channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Did the Novel-Reading Man Disappear?
item.description: Men are leaving fiction reading behind. Some people want to change that.

item.title: RFK Jr.’s Handpicked Vaccine Advisers Are Set to Meet for the First Time
item.description: The panel will revisit the hepatitis B shot given at birth, among others. The former head of an anti-vaccine group has been hired as a special employe...

item.title: Rubio Fleshes Out Trump’s Case That Iran Nuclear Capacity Was Eliminated
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said U.S. strikes had destroyed a facility that is key to producing a nuclear weapon. He railed against a less optimist...

item.title: Starbucks is changing how it charges for extra syrups, matcha powder
item.description: CEO Brian Niccol has been working to reverse a sales slump at Starbucks since he took the helm in September.

item.title: Mamdani’s Win Is More Striking When You Look at How He Won
item.description: Mamdani won in parts of the city people wouldn’t normally expect. Democrats should pay attention to his positive message and laser focus on costs.

item.title: The UK is buying F-35 fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear weapons—but they’ll need Trump’s approval before dropping bombs
item.description: The United Kingdom will buy 12 U.S.-made F-35A fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear bombs.

item.title: Canva’s CTO encourages all 5,000 employees to find the AI tools that work best for them
item.description: Brendan Humphreys, the Chief Technology Officer at Canva, says all employees play a big role in figuring out what AI-enabled workplace tools are best ...

item.title: FedEx warns of pain ahead with tariffs weighing on demand
item.description: “We just simply cannot predict how that is going to play out,” FedEx Chief Customer Officer Brie Carere said.

item.title: Trump’s budget bill and DOGE’s IRS staffing cuts could lead to a nightmare 2026 tax season, watchdog warns
item.description: The IRS lost one-quarter of its employees through staffing cuts, an independent watchdog reported Wednesday.

item.title: British Man Is Charged Over Attempted Mock Wedding With Girl, 9, at Disneyland Paris
item.description: The French authorities said a 39-year-old had attempted to conduct the ceremony with a minor on Saturday. The British police say he is a convicted sex...

item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said U.S. strikes had destroyed a facility that is key to producing a nuclear weapon. He railed against a less optimist...

item.title: Trump says the U.S. will meet with Iran but downplays the need for a nuclear agreement.
Tensions Grow Between Iran and the U.N. Nuclear Watchdog
item.description: The Iranian government has raised the prospect that inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency may be ejected from the country.

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Says U.S. and Iran to Meet; White House Disputes Damage Report
item.description: President Trump said discussions with Iran would take place next week as administration officials forcefully pushed back on a classified report that q...

item.title: Passenger Recounts ‘Tense’ Moments After Engine Sparks Force Plane to Land
item.description: The American Airlines flight with 153 passengers, which was headed to Charlotte, N.C., returned to Las Vegas shortly after takeoff. No one was injured...
